meanings.definition: Tough, elastic connective tissue found in various parts of the body.
meanings.sent1: The cartilages in my knee help absorb shock when I jump.
meanings.sent2: Doctors found damaged cartilages in his shoulder during the examination.
meanings.sent3: The cartilages in my ear must be working hard to help me hear so well!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as cartilages, connecting people in a seamless bond.
meanings.sent5: The cartilages in his nose made it easy for him to breathe clearly.

meanings.sent1: She picked up the tiny cartilages that had fallen off the model skeleton.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully removed the damaged cartilages from the patient's knee.
meanings.sent3: I found a cartilages-shaped cloud in the sky today!
meanings.sent4: His words were like cartilages, holding the fragile conversation together.
meanings.sent5: The cartilages of the puzzle fit perfectly, completing the picture.
